text: Antoine Pinay (; 30 December 1891 – 13 December 1994) was a French conservative politician. He served as Prime Minister of France from March 1952 through March 1953.TIME Magazine , 19 Feb. 1973. He was also Minister of Public Works, Transport, Tourism, Finance, Economic and Foreign Affairs. He died in Saint-Chamond, Loire, at the age of 102. He is the third longest-lived national head of government or head of state in history, behind Chau Sen Cocsal Chhum and Celâl Bayar. ==References== Category:1891 births Category:1994 deaths Category:French centenarians Category:People from Rhône (department) Category:Prime ministers of France Category:French Ministers of Finance Category:Politicians from Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes
title: Antoine Pinay
